author: {'steamid': '76561198008774405', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1482032606}
review:
Okay im .7 hours into this game. I can't take it anymore. This game is not well done. Okay let me take that back a bit it has everything to BE good but they missed some points. Points that anyone should think of before releasing a game. 

How do you rapidly upgrade? I had 0 clue to how to do what OTHER clicker games do of letting you instantly buy 10, 25, or more upgrades at once until a random loading screen when I reopened it to see if the game saved. (no -1 here as I will tally it with a later complaint)

 I guess that WAS an issue they fixed. The game wouldn't save. +1 to fast response. -1 for not knowing about it before launch. 

So the game give you nothing other then heres something you figure it out. By now we should all know how to play these games. I get it but come on give new people something. -1 for 0 direction. 

SUPER LOUD. Okay the music is good though it gets on your nerves with constant clicking SFX. But thats not the issue. The issue is no control for volumes. Well you get on and off but nothing else. I have seen really crappy clicker games that you can turn down but not off the volume on. That escaped this dev team. To give you an idea on how LOUD this game is I was watching youtube when I launched it. Volume was comfortable sitting around 25%. The game blarred so loud I threw my headphones off. +1 good music -1 on 50% control on it. 

Crystal shop(premium RL $ currency) upgrades. Screw you. Seriously devs. Screw you. It SAID it cost 5,10,15 crystals WHY DID IT CHARGE ME 6,11,16?! Oh it gets better. The second level overcharged MORE. Its price is whats listed +level of upgrade. So if level 100 was 100 it would really be 200 I'm guessing. Thank god I didn't do what I normally do and toss money at the free game cause it looks good and I want to start faster to catch up. -1 Devs which means a -4 cause this is #3 so im doing what you did for the upgrades. 

Ascension. No warning. Doesn't tell you what it does. Just gotta figure it out. Just to let you know its the lose everything to restart somewhat stronger option. Not gonna -1 kind of goes with lack of any info up above. But I wanted this after the Crystal shop so im not giving a super - due to adding them together. 

REALLY easy to replace good gear with crap. Unless its legendary if you click it it will replace the better stuff. Kind of feels like anti-auto clicker thing. Not gonna add or subtract really for this one either. One hand its cool that you have to pay attention. Other hand this is a clicker game so I feel like I shouldn't need to. This ones on me devs. 

There is more but its things I can personally over look so I won't go into them really. These are main points. 

TL;DR
Pros:
Looks good. 
Good music. 

Cons:
No direction. 
Premium shop over charges you. 
Can't control volume its either on or off. 

Overall score 4/10 Slices of Bacon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198316796717', 'num_games_owned': 89, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1482142430}
review:
Clicker Guild is a beautifully animated free to play clicker, with a special take on the genre by adding randomly generated loot for the characters. 

Special Features of Clicker Guild 
Many unlockable heroes 
Different areas to explore 
A special take on the clicker genre by randomly generating loot 
Animated monsters and recruitable heroes 
Rebirth and Artifacts 
Achievements 
Free to Play

author: {'steamid': '76561198045381877', 'num_games_owned': 557, 'num_reviews': 2587, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1482009872}
review: Clicker Guild is a pretty neat clicker game that I have so far enjoyed. I like the art style, and think the gameplay is decent enough for clicker and idle "fans". While it certainly is nothing new and groundbreaking, its not too bad. It has some bugs at the moment, and launch was a little rocky with save file issues, but most of that has already been fixed or is currently being fixed as of this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047899489', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 5344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1793, 'last_played': 1482789729}
review:
The animation is fun and most all the characters have interesting designs. The gameplay is decent as far as clicker games go. It's a decent clicker game which is better than most I've played recently. It also has a fair amount of character and charisma thrown into the mix.

Now that I have that out of the way let's get to the negatives. It is full of bugs, most of which occur in the STR system which is filled with flawed math that does not add up and actually increase your overall DPS the amount it should. There are also bugs in the microtransaction store, but I haven't utilized the shop so I cannot say from personal experience.

In addition, progress becomes stagnant and slow after about halfway into zone 4 (which is early on) and takes hours upon hours to earn enough money to even afford one upgrade for someone you've already unlocked. When you ascend for Stars to upgrade global stats you barely get any and need to ascend at least 3 times to afford the first level of any upgrade. Given how long it takes to get to the point of ascension you could easily start from scratch on any other clicker and upgrade everything at least twice in roughly the same amount of time.

It's not a bad game. It's simply slow AF. That can be a good thing or a bad thing given who you ask.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031452320', 'num_games_owned': 700, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1481995463}
review:
It's a good start but needs further development. I gave it a thumbs down for the following reasons but will change it to a thumbs up if they are adressed.

The graphics are very nice for a clicker game but they should be limited to the game itself, the UI needs a lot of work and the fancy graphics get in the way there, especially for the achievements tab.

The concept is interesting but underdeveloped, there is nothing that sets this apart from other clicker games. There needs to be more mechanics involving the heros. You can level them up forever but after lvl 150 nothing changes anymore, not even their attack power. There needs to be interesting mechanics implemented that make every hero viable, at least for short periods of time.

My biggest gripe with the game is that it's nearly 100% automated. The item mechanic is nice but since so many of them drop and the game always equips the best one for you they might as well not be there. I know these games are supposed to be played "idle" but this one really pushes this to the limit, there is nearly nothing for you to do. 

In short: Needs more things to do, needs beter developed mechanics, needs to do something to set it apart from other clicker games and needs a better UI.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069935790', 'num_games_owned': 286, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1496548911}
review:
Clicker Guilds is a really nice game. Good art, equipment system, and good upgrade system. But currently there is no save function which is a huge mistake. But, I'm not going to give this game a non-reccomendation mainly because I will be too lazy to change it in the future when they inevitably do give this game an auto-save/manual save feature. Just hit the follow button and wait for the announcement about the save feature being in place.

*EDIT*

Since they fixed the no save feature Clicker Guild's is just as good as all the other clicker games if not better. I enjoy clicker games alot but this one brings it all to the table.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980258693', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 700, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 700, 'last_played': 1482016589}
review:
More of a bugs list than a review but I wouldn't play until most of these get fixed. 

Ascension button blends in too well with other spells and never asks validation yes/no. 
Doesn't say how many stars you'll get upon ascension. 
When you do ascend and use stars, the STR increase literally does nothing making ascension pointless. 
Often picking up a +DPS item will decrease your dps even if not replacing crit or other stats, just purely STR so it's a guess at best sometimes. 
Tooltips needed for things like stars (do they do anything by themself?) and items when equipping (Accurate ones at least).
Some spells (crits at least) don't currently work. 
Gain nothing from leveling heroes past lv150 except for maybe last one for more dps but linear dps increase with exponential price increase.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986227300', 'num_games_owned': 1293, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1481978216}
review:
It's a pretty run of the mill Clicker Heroes clone expect monsters drop random loot that you have to click to pick up, and if you are away the game will auto-sell them. 

The "reset"/ascend button doesn't have any confirmation if you want to do it and doesn't show you how much of the resource you get before you reset. There's only about five of the persistent upgrades (unless more unlock later) that you can level up and they're even called "ancients" like in CH, at least try to come up with something original.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992681922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 522, 'last_played': 1481974689}
review:
Not a good game. Lots of bugs, here is some I found

Sometimes a skill will get a cooldown of 999999minutes after use (I checked and that's nearly 2 years lol).
I had coins not give money suddenly, making the game impossible from that point.
You can't view more than three trained click skills, UI there is broken and scroll does nothing.
The item equipper just equips items in order, replacing the first then second then third, repeating. This is regardless of whether this makes an upgrade or downgrade, or if it would be an upgrade for another slot.
After a reset you get stars, first time I tried this the game crashed. The second time I gained 7 stars, spent 5 stars for a damage boost and had 1 stars left. Nice maths mate.

Balance wise you really only need crit. Crit multi seems to be mostly hidden but boosts damage many magnitudes.
Each new hero can give maybe half of your total damage, making the earliest ones dead wood. Hell their damage output is so insane that they easily are the only damage you do, your clicks don't count for much. Make the latest heroes crit more and you will advance fast.

So yeah maybe real balance is done and lots and lots of bug fixing is done, but until then stay away.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968933210', 'num_games_owned': 1310, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1625483382}
review:
Cool job guys, you released an idle/clicker game with no save function. Fucking really?

EDIT DEC 17 8PM EST: Save issue ostensibly patched. Leaving rating as is at current until functionality is certain.

Save seems to work now, but a new issue is apparent. When spending stars to upgrade an ancient, it consumes a number of stars equal to the value to upgrade for the next step. The first step says it takes 5, but it actually consumed 6.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974153096', 'num_games_owned': 1522, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 5450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1529114120}
review: Can't manually save and there is no auto save, meaning anytime you close the game you lose all progress, making the game basically unplayable.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963819455', 'num_games_owned': 581, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1481952874}
review:
So. Many. Bugs.

Worst one is the known bug of not saving your progress.  In an idling game that's just... how the heck does that make it into release?  Then there's text in descriptions not fitting in the window for some of the skills, or purchasing some skills with the reset currency charging you more than it should (it said 10, charged me 11), or turning off some options actually preventing you from getting gold.  It's an interesting concept, but the random loot means it's not just waiting for enough gold to level, but having to get the gear as well and you can't idle for gear.  If you don't click on it, it vanishes, so it's not really an idling game and definitely more in the clicking realms.  That's the only "new" concept it brings to the table and it's somewhat flawed.

The bugs are what really kills it.  I mean come on, hours after release and still not saving progress?  Seems like it was just an attempt at a fast cash grab.  The fact there are square chests that drop and the cash shop has a (coming soon) for keys that would appear to work on those (though they open for free right now) just reinforces this was an attempt at a fast cash grab without really any effort or diligence put into it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999968656', 'num_games_owned': 488, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1481952462}
review:
There's better clickers out there. Not idle friendly, not even less than 100% of your attention friendly; the only way to get ahead and make progress is to manage the "item" drops you get and the upgrade system is designed in such a way you can easily sabotage your own gear and replace something valuable with something worthless on one accidental click. Then there's the "ascension" system which resets all your stuff without a warning prompt or summary screen to tell you exactly what you're getting yourself into. Also, even if you ascend with more "stars" than necessary to make a global bonus purchase (used to speed up the subsequent run) the shop doesn't seem to care, it takes your entire balance to fund the upgrade. Confusing and not clearly working as intended.

Much of this could be addressed in updates and it could be improved in many ways but in its current state it's not worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060718360', 'num_games_owned': 185, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1482954258}
review:
As someone who came to enjoy clicker games via Cookie Clicker and Clicker Heroes (pre-steam release), I could really enjoy this game. The music is calming and enjoyable, the animations and art are well done and the equipment mechanic is very unique to me. 

However, like most complaints for this game, the instability and uncertainty of losing all of your game progress at any point in time is the true and only reason for me not recommending this to anyone. With some stability fixes and maybe a manual save feature (maybe a couple quality of life UI clarity changes) this game could replace clicker heroes for me. Unfortunately there's no telling when one could lose game progress, and I can't always have this game running either. 

I would gladly change my review to recommended once the game recieves the stability fixes it requires, and I deeply encourage the dev team to please take the time to ensure that losing data at any given time is no longer an inconvenience for players. I would greatly appreciate it, and thank you in advanced.

P.S: Yes I did lose all of my data earlier thus why I cannot recommend the game.

UPDATE: The most recent patch 1.01 fixed the instability. Thank you, dev team! :3

author: {'steamid': '76561197970568243', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1481939891}
review:
I think there are better idle / clicker games out there to spend your time on. For the most part this does not have anything that you haven't seen before.

This game could have been really good, but they missed some major points. In it's favor, I will say that the one thing it has going for it is decent graphics.

-Poor interface. 
Having to scroll through a list is suboptimal. You can only see a handful of heros at a time. Combined with the fact that you have a bunch of different tabs, that is no good. I'm willing to put up with that kinda stuff in a game with more depth, but not from a clicker. The fact of the mater is, its not even like it needs to take up that much space. Your only option is to buy more levels. The only important information is their strength and the cost to buy more levels.

-Poor feedback
The graphics are this games one highlight. All of your "guild" members are fully animated. That's great. However, their idle animations have a lot of bouncyness which makes it look like their attack animation. It would have been easy to make the enemy flash when your guys attack or damange numbers appear over their head. Instead, it really doesn't feel like your guys do anything other than dance around.

-Missed opportunity
OK, this game could have been something really different. For example, the monsters could do damage back to your guild members (and every wave they all get back up). Then you could have heros that heal, heros that debuff, heros that buff. It could still have the same core clicker growth and feel, but with at least the illusion of depth. It would have been something we haven't seen before.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067241548', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1481993834}

author: {'steamid': '76561198052270493', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1481938460}
review:
Overall its ok. Better than most clickers that I had tried both on and off Steam. Main thing that sets it above most is the looting system. Your units including yourself get 3 slots to put gear into. It is fun for a bit but you just end up looking at what has a green dps boost and not so much the actual gear itself. Gear gets dropped at random by mobs and bosses. The bonuses you get I dont really feel make you want to restart just for a small % boost in one of sever fields like damage and crit chance. 

It is free so give it a chance and see how you enjoy it yourself =D

author: {'steamid': '76561198039398503', 'num_games_owned': 709, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 797, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1520145394}
review:
I was thoroughly enjoying this game. So much so, that I bought a $5 pack of gems and used it on the X2 multiplier for damage. I have already ascended and was climbing the ranks. My computer rebooted after updates and I came back to find ALL progress have vanished. My purchased Gems AFTER purchasing the multiplier are there, but without my multiplier bonuses added. So, my money and my time were wasted playing a game that you can't save?? Did I miss a save button somewhere? 

This game could have been AWESOME. How do developers miss a crucial thing like being able to SAVE THE GAME?

**Update 12/18/2016**

Developer fixed the save issue I had AND restored my purchase. Faith restored.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983889500', 'num_games_owned': 312, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1682548747}
review: Probably the funnest clicker game I have played. The loot system makes it very engaging. Its hard to turn away and leave it running in the background when there is a chance a epic or legendary piece of gear might drop. The music is really good and so is the artwork. I just wish there was a pause button. You can quit anytime and it saves your progress automatically. But sometimes I just wish i could pause and look at the gear I have found without worrying about gear dropping I might miss. I ascended on accident and recieved 5 stars which you can put into carryover bonuses. Im not sure if you only recieve 5 per each time you ascend or more if you go farther before you ascend. I hope they add more bonuses for ascending because I can see myself unlocking all the ones they have now pretty quickly. Definately a fun clicker.
